1.text: I the man seeing affliction by the rod of his wrath.

2.text: He led me and he brought darkness and not light.

3.text: Surely he will turn back against me; he will turn his hand all the day.

4.text: He wasted away my flesh and my skin; he broke my bones.

5.text: He built against me, and he will surround with poison and distress.

6.text: He caused me to dwell in darknesses as the dead of old.

7.text: He walled about me and I shall not go forth: he loaded my brass.

8.text: Also when I shall exclaim and cry out, he stopped my prayer.

9.text: He walled up my ways with hewn stones, he made crooked my beaten paths.

10.text: He is to me a bear lying in wait, a lion in secret places.

11.text: He turned aside my ways and he will tear me in pieces: he set me a desolation.

12.text: He bent his bow, he will set me up as a mark for the arrow.

13.text: He brought the sons of his quiver into my reins.

14.text: I was a derision to all my people; their song all the day.

15.text: He filled me with bitternesses, he gave me wormwood to drink.

16.text: He will break my teeth with gravel stones, he covered me with ashes.

17.text: Thou wilt cast of my soul from peace: I forgat good.

18.text: And saying, My glory perished, and my hope from Jehovah:

19.text: Remembering my affliction and my bitterness, the wormwood and the poison.

20.text: Remembering, my soul will remember, and will be bowed down upon me.

21.text: I will turn this back to my heart; for this I shall hope.

22.text: The mercies of Jehovah are that we were not consumed, for his compassions were not finished.

23.text: New for the mornings: great thy faithfulness.

24.text: Jehovah my portion, said my soul; for this I will hope toward him.

25.text: Good Jehovah to those waiting for him, to the soul that will seek him.

26.text: Good, and he shall wait and stand still for the salvation of Jehovah.

27.text: Good for a man that he shall lift up the yoke in his youth.

28.text: He will sit alone and be silent, for he laid upon him.

29.text: He will give his mouth in the dust, if perhaps there is hope.

30.text: He will give the cheek to him striking him: he will be filled with reproach.

31.text: For Jehovah will not cast of forever:

32.text: For if he afflicted, and he compassionated according to the multitude of his mercy.

33.text: For he afflicted not from his heart and grieved the sons of men,

34.text: To crush under his feet all the bound of the earth,

35.text: To turn aside the judgment of a man before the face of the Most High.

36.text: To pervert a man in his contention Jehovah saw not.

37.text: Who this saying, And it shall be Jehovah commanding not?

38.text: From the mouth of the Most High shall not come forth evil and good.

39.text: Why shall a living man murmur? a man for his sin?

40.text: We will search out our ways, and examine and turn back even to Jehovah.

41.text: We will lift up our hearts upon the hands to God in the heavens.

42.text: We transgressed and resisted: thou forgavest not.

43.text: Thou didst cover with anger, and thou wilt pursue us: thou didst slay, thou didst not pity.

44.text: Thou didst cover over thyself with a cloud from a prayer passing through.

45.text: Thou didst set us the offscouring and despising in the midst of peoples.

46.text: All our enemies opened their mouth against us.

47.text: Fear and a snare were to us, desolation and breaking.

48.text: Mine eye will bring down streams of water for the breaking of the daughter of my people.

49.text: Mine eye flowed and it will not be silent, from no intermission,

50.text: Till Jehovah shall look forth and see from the heavens.

51.text: Mine eye will glean for my soul for all the daughters of my city.

52.text: Hunting, they hunted me as a bird, mine enemies, gratuitously.

53.text: They cut off my life in the pit, and cast a stone upon me.

54.text: Waters were spread over my head; I said I was cut off.

55.text: I called thy name, O Jehovah, in the pit underneath.

56.text: Thou heardest my voice: thou wilt not hide thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.

57.text: Thou drewest near in the day I shall call thee: thou saidst, Thou shalt not fear.

58.text: Thou didst contend, O Jehovah, the contentions of my soul; thou didst redeem my life.

59.text: Thou sawest, O Jehovah, my bowing down: judge thou my judgment.

60.text: Thou sawest all their vengeance, all their purposes against me.

61.text: Thou heardest their reproach, O Jehovah, all their purposes against me.

62.text: The lips of those rising up, and their devices against me all the day.

63.text: Their sitting and their rising, look thou: I their song.

64.text: Thou wilt turn back to them a retribution, O Jehovah, according to the work of their hands.

65.text: Thou wilt give to them a covering of heart, thy curse to them.

66.text: Thou wilt pursue in thine anger, and thou wilt destroy them from under the heavens, O Jehovah.
